channel.title: Spring JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DATAMONGO-493] Criteria.ne() method converts all value into ObjectId
item.description:
The QueryMapper.getMappedObject() converts all $ne criterion value into ObjectId.

Fix : Test for id key like $in criterion
item.summary: Criteria.ne() method converts all value into ObjectId

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Can you get a bit more precise, maybe giving an example of the domain class you have plus the query, the current and expected output?

Use case example :

UserEntity {
 
   String id;
 
   List<String> publishers = new ArrayList<String>();
 
}
 

mongoTemplate.find(Query.query(Criteria.where("id").is("id_value").and("publishers").ne("a_string_value"))

is converted into 

{ "_id" : { "$oid" : "500832fc34faf0a2d4435f9c"} , "publishers" : { "$ne" : { "$oid" : "4fcf9d285de1f92b9fc64312"}}}

instead of 

{ "_id" : { "$oid" : "500832fc34faf0a2d4435f9c"} , "publishers" : { "$ne" : "4fcf9d285de1f92b9fc64312"}}

The QueryMapper.getMappedObject() fix proposition :

public DBObject getMappedObject(DBObject query, MongoPersistentEntity<?> entity) {
 
 
 
        DBObject newDbo = new BasicDBObject();
 
 
 
        for (String key : query.keySet()) {
 
            String newKey = key;
 
            Object value = query.get(key);
 
            if (isIdKey(key, entity)) {
 
                if (value instanceof DBObject) {
 
 
 
                    DBObject valueDbo = (DBObject) value;
 
                    if (valueDbo.containsField("$in") || valueDbo.containsField("$nin")) {
 
                        String inKey = valueDbo.containsField("$in") ? "$in" : "$nin";
 
                        List<Object> ids = new ArrayList<Object>();
 
                        for (Object id : (Iterable<?>) valueDbo.get(inKey)) {
 
                            ids.add(convertId(id));
 
                        }
 
                        valueDbo.put(inKey, ids.toArray(new Object[ids.size()]));
 
                    } else if (valueDbo.containsField("$ne")) {
 
                        if (! (valueDbo.get("$ne") instanceof ObjectId)) {
 
                            valueDbo.put("$ne", convertId(valueDbo.get("$ne")));
 
                        }
 
                    } else {
 
                        value = getMappedObject((DBObject) value, entity);
 
                    }
 
                } else {
 
                    value = convertId(value);
 
                }
 
                newKey = "_id";
 
            } else if (key.startsWith("$") && key.endsWith("or")) {
 
                // $or/$nor
 
                Iterable<?> conditions = (Iterable<?>) value;
 
                BasicBSONList newConditions = new BasicBSONList();
 
                Iterator<?> iter = conditions.iterator();
 
                while (iter.hasNext()) {
 
                    newConditions.add(getMappedObject((DBObject) iter.next(), entity));
 
                }
 
                value = newConditions;
 
            } else if (value instanceof DBObject) {
 
                newDbo.put(newKey, getMappedObject((DBObject) value, entity));
 
                continue;
 
            }
 
 
 
            newDbo.put(newKey, converter.convertToMongoType(value));
 
        }
 
 
 
        return newDbo;
 
    }

The private final QueryMapper MongoTemplate member is instanciated into the constructor, so it can't be override without rewrite MongoTemplate. I did not found another hack.

This is quiet critical.
Good catch! Fix deployed into 1.1.x branch. Feel free to give the latest snapshot a try.

It works. I'm waiting for the GA release.
Thank you.
